jence.jni

Class J4210U

  • java.lang.Object
    • jence.jni.J4210U

  • public class J4210U
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class that connects to the device driver and performs all operations.
    Author:
    Ejaz Jamil

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  J4210U.ReaderInfo
      Parses the reader information data from the device driver and assigns them to the public variables.
      static class  J4210U.ScanResult
      ScanResult class is used to convert the byte array returned by the JNI driver into the Antenna, RSSI, Count, Epc length and EPC value data.
      static class  J4210U.TagInfo
      TagInfo class contains information about the tag.
      static class  J4210U.TagType
      List of all supported Chip type.

    • Method Detail

      • getIsoTimestamp

        public static java.lang.String getIsoTimestamp()
        Gets current timestamp in the format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.uuu +|-Z. Example: 2021-08-12 15:32:931 +4 indicate August 12th 2021 at 3:32PM and 931 usec in a timezone 4 hours ahead of greenwitch mean time.
        Returns:
        ISO timestamp.

      • hex2bytes

        public static byte[] hex2bytes(java.lang.String hex,
                               int arraySize)
        Converts hex to byte array.
        Parameters:
        hex - hex value as String.
        arraySize - Size of the byte array to return.
        Returns:
        byte array generated from hex value.

      • getVersion

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getGPInput

        public boolean getGPInput(int gpNumber)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets GPI input from the specified GPI port.
        Parameters:
        gpNumber - 1 -> GPI0, 2 -> GPI1.
        Returns:
        GPI input state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setGPOutput

        public void setGPOutput(int gpNumber)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets GPO0 or GPO1 to desired value.
        Parameters:
        gpNumber - GPO0 is bit-0 and GPO1 is bit-1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • filter

        public void filter(int offsetByte,
                   byte[] maskBytes)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a filter for use during scanning.
        Parameters:
        offsetByte - offset byte (word unit, multiple of 2)
        maskBytes - mask bytes, can be any value. The array size must be multiple of 2.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • writeWord

        public void writeWord(byte[] epc,
                      byte[] word,
                      int windex)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes 2 byte word into the User memory pointed by word index (even) of the tag pointed by the EPC value.
        Parameters:
        epc - a valid EPC value.
        word - 2 byte word to write.
        windex - word index (even)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • readWord

        public byte[] readWord(byte[] epc,
                       int windex)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads a word from User memory with word index for the tag with valid EPC value.
        Parameters:
        epc - a valid EPC value.
        windex - word index (must be even).
        Returns:
        2 byte word of the content of memory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public void open(java.lang.String comPort,
                 int baudrate)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Open the reader at the Com Port. The COM port may be found by opening the Device Manager in Windows.
        Parameters:
        comPort - com port string, for example "COM31", etc.
        baudrate - TODO

      • auth

        public void auth(byte[] password)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes an authentication password to be used during successive scans.
        Parameters:
        password - a valid password of 8 byte.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - a general exception is thrown.

      • writeEpcWord

        public void writeEpcWord(byte[] epc,
                         byte[] word,
                         int windex)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes EPC Word (16-bit) to the tag pointed by the epc value. The words will be written into EPC memory's windex (word index) position.
        Parameters:
        epc - tag's EPC value.
        word - a single word to write (16-bit or 2-bytes)
        windex - a word index (not byte index). A word index is even byte indexes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - a general exception is thrown.

      • setQ

        public void setQ(int q)
          throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        q -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setSession

        public void setSession(int session)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets session number for the reader. If there are three other readers, then each should be assigned a different session number so the one reader does not affect the other reader's scan.
        Parameters:
        session - Session number 0 - 3.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
